subject: Sleep
title: Tau Protein and Sleep
description: A quick, practical guide to Tau Protein and Sleep.

hook.text: Beta-amyloid gets all the attention in Alzheimer's research. But another protein called tau may be even more deadly.

buildup.text: Tau tangles spread through the brain and correlate more closely with cognitive decline than amyloid plaques.

discovery.text: Sleep deprivation increases tau levels in cerebrospinal fluid by over 50 percent in healthy adults.

twist.text: Unlike amyloid, tau spreads between neurons like an infection. Sleep loss may accelerate this transmission.

climax.text: Protecting sleep may be one of the few modifiable factors that slows tau spread in the aging brain.

punchline.text: Sleep may be the brain's best defense against its own toxic proteins.

quiz.question: How does sleep deprivation affect tau protein?
options: It increases tau levels by over 50 percent
